definition: Zhang Hua (232-300), Western Jin writer, poet and politician/Zhang Hua (1958-1982), student held up as a martyr after he died saving an old peasant from a septic tank/other Zhang Hua's too numerous to mention
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
magnificent/splendid/flowery
old variant of 花[hua1]/flower
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
abbr. for China

sentences.english: Zhang Hua quickly ran back to his flat and poured water over his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 张华迅速的跑回他的公寓，并用水弄湿他的夹克。

sentences.english: Let me introduce myself first. My name is Zhang Hua.
sentences.chinese: 我先自我介绍一下，我叫张华。

sentences.english: Zhang Hua left Taicang Normal School eight years ago.
sentences.chinese: 张华八年前毕业于太仓师范师范学校。

sentences.english: Zhanghua and Liping passed the exam. What about the other students?
sentences.chinese: 张华和李平通过了考试，其他的学生怎么样？

sentences.english: In the Taikang period , Zhang Hua play an important role.
sentences.chinese: 第四章论述张华在晋初诗风演变过程中所起到的作用。

sentences.english: During this visit, Mr Zhang Hua and Mr Huang has given presents to each other.
sentences.chinese: 期间，张华董事长还和黄南美老先生互赠了礼品。

sentences.english: Here is Zhang Hua's family photo.
sentences.chinese: 这是关于张华家庭的照片。

sentences.english: Who do you like better, Li Ming or Zhang Hua?
sentences.chinese: 李明和张华，你较喜欢谁？

sentences.english: He is sitting between Zhang Hua and me.
Gavin Zhang was admitted to practice PRC laws in 1997.
sentences.chinese: 张华律师自1997年开始律师执业。

sentences.english: Zhang Hua is with NTO of China based in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 张华在中国旅游公司驻东京分公司工作。

sentences.english: Whats wrong with you, Zhang Hua?

definition: Yang Jun (571-600), son of the first Sui emperor 楊堅|杨坚[Yang2 Jian1]
Zhang Bin (1979-), CCTV sports presenter
Liu Yi (-285), famous incorruptible official of Western Jin dynasty the Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316)/Liu Yi (-412), general of Eastern Jin dynasty 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420)
Li Zhe, personal name of fourth Tang Emperor Zhongzong 唐中宗[Tang2 Zhong1 zong1] (656-710), reigned 705-710
oriole/black-naped oriole (Oriolus chinensis)
Wang Ping (1962-2013), PRC crosstalk actor
History of Chen of the Southern Dynasties, ninth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Yao Silian 姚思廉[Yao2 Si1 lian2] in 636 during Tang dynasty, 36 scrolls
Li Delin (530-590), historian of Northern Wei and Sui dynasty

surname Wei/name of vassal state of Zhou dynasty from 661 BC in Shanxi, one of the Seven Hero Warring States/Wei state, founded by Cao Cao 曹操[Cao2 Cao1], one of the Three Kingdoms after the Han dynasty/the Wei dynasty 221-265/Wei prefecture and Wei county at different historical periods
tower over a palace gateway (old)
class or grade/generation/plaintiff and defendant (old)/government department (old)
surname Cao/Zhou Dynasty vassal state
Li Yanshou (fl. 650), compiler of History of the Southern 南史 and Northern Dynasties 北史
Zhang Bao (-184), leader of the Yellow Turban rebels during the late Han 漢朝|汉朝[Han4 chao2]
Li Ye, personal name of twentieth Tang emperor Zhaozong 昭宗[Zhao1 zong1] (867-904), reigned 888-904
Yang Bin (1963-), Chinese-Dutch businessman
Zhang Ning (1975-), PRC female badminton player and Olympic gold medalist
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
